body_html:
Oh, I see you updated docs recently.

Note: It would be useful to allow a variable number of target classes per example. We hope to 
provide this functionality in a future release. For now, if you have a variable number of target 
classes, you can pad them out to a constant number by either repeating them or by padding with 
an otherwise unused class.

Won't such padding interfere the results? Because of this:

Note: In the case where num_true > 1, we assign to each target class the target probability 1 / num_true so that the target probabilities sum to 1 per-example.

Do proportions/distribution matter?

It looks like you are already working on it, still if you need help implementing this feature, I would be willing to contribute.

an otherwise unused class.

Won't such padding interfere the results? Because of this:
Note: In the case where num_true > 1, we assign to each target class the target probability 1 / num_true so that the target probabilities sum to 1 per-example.

Do proportions/distribution matter?
It looks like you are already working on it, still if you need help implementing this feature, I would be willing to contribute.
body:
Oh, I see you updated docs recently. 
```
Note: It would be useful to allow a variable number of target classes per example. We hope to 
provide this functionality in a future release. For now, if you have a variable number of target 
classes, you can pad them out to a constant number by either repeating them or by padding with 
an otherwise unused class.
```
Won't such padding interfere the results? Because of this:
```
Note: In the case where num_true > 1, we assign to each target class the target probability 1 / num_true so that the target probabilities sum to 1 per-example.
```
Do proportions/distribution matter?

It looks like you are already working on it, still if you need help implementing this feature, I would be willing to contribute.
